page.title: 01Coast strip North ofGirvan
page.content: 9/12 of block comprises sea (Firth of Clyde 3/12 of block is devoted to arable, dairy and early potato farming (3 farms) the A77 trunk road linking Ayr and Stranraer, a seaweed processing factory (Alginate Industries employing 313 men and women), the remains of a disused railway track and the conceled ruins of an early Christian chapel. Trees are sparse and wind- bent. The coastline is rocky nd pebbled and devoid of sand. The block is picturesque and enjoys views of Arran, Ailsa Craig and ireland as well as the inland hills of Girvan Valley
